title: AI-powered issue capture sidebar
description:
Add a chat/capture interface for creating issues from natural language input.

## Overview
A sidebar or panel where users can describe tasks/bugs in natural language, and AI parses them into structured beads issues.

## User Flow
1. User opens capture panel (button or keyboard shortcut)
2. Types or pastes unstructured text: 'login is broken on mobile, also need dark mode, and there's that firefox button bug'
3. Clicks 'Generate Issues' (or auto on pause)
4. AI returns preview of parsed issues with title, type, priority
5. User can edit/remove before confirming
6. 'Create All' or 'Create Selected' commits to beads

## Model Selection
- Dropdown or toggle to switch between providers:
  - Claude (Sonnet 4) - best tool use reliability
  - Gemini 3 Flash - cheaper, video support, 78% SWE-bench
  - (Future: GPT-4o, local models)
- Store preference in localStorage
- Both use same tool schema, just different API calls

## Technical Approach
- Use Claude/Gemini API with tool use (function calling)
- Define create_issue tool with schema
- AI calls it multiple times from single input
- Preview before commit
- Batch create via existing WebSocket server

## UI Options (pick one)
- [ ] Right sidebar (Linear-style)
- [ ] Bottom drawer
- [ ] Modal with chat interface
- [ ] Floating capture button → expandable panel

## Tool Schema
```typescript
{
  name: 'create_issue',
  input_schema: {
    title: string,
    type: 'bug' | 'feature' | 'task' | 'epic',
    priority: 0-4,
    description?: string,
    labels?: string[],
    parent_id?: string  // for subtasks under epics
  }
}
```

## Future Enhancements
- Voice input (speech-to-text → AI → issues)
- Video/image attachment (Gemini only)
- Auto-suggest dependencies based on existing issues
- Multi-turn refinement ('make that bug P0')
- MCP integration for both Claude and Gemini

## Dependencies
- API key configuration (Claude and/or Gemini)
- API endpoint on server for AI calls
- Settings UI for model selection
